PDIP Puji Menag yang Lempar Isu Cadar-Celana Cingkrang
06 Nov 2019, 08:18 by Nur Azizah Rizki Astuti
Jakarta - PDIP 'membela' Menteri Agama (Menag) Fachrul Razi yang mengakui melempar isu larangan cadar dan celana cingkrang untuk menjadi gaung bagi masyarakat. PDIP menilai Fachrul tidak pernah menyatakan bahwa dua hal itu dilarang, namun masih mengkajinya.
"Saya pikir dia juga sangat moderat ya, dalam hal ini dia kan juga bilang bahwa usulan ini masih akan dikaji, usulan yang tentang pelarangan (cadar dan celanan cingkrang) ini kan dia akan mengkaji. Dia punya statement, dia punya pemikiran, tapi dalam tanda kutip dia juga menempatkan kata bahwa usulan ini masih akan dikaji," kata anggota Komisi VIII F-PDIP Diah Pitaloka kepada wartawan, Rabu (6/11/2019).
"Dia kan menurut saya sangat fair lah, sangat moderat ya. Dia kan tidak bilang di Kemenag ini akan dilarang, kan tidak bikin statement. Dia mungkin punya pemikiran, dilontarkan, diikuti, 'yaudah kita kaji dulu'," imbuhnya.
Menurut Diah, tak masalah jika Kemenag melakukan kajian terhadap larangan cadar dan celana cingkrang di lingkungan instansi pemerintah. Soal masalah seragam saat bertugas ini Diah menganalogikannya dengan polisi yang 'dilarang' memakai sarung.
"Sederhananya, misalnya Kapolri bilang bahwa polisi dalam bertugas tidak boleh pakai sarung. Itu kan bukan berarti orang nggak boleh pakai sarung atau melarang orang pakai sarung, hanya saat bertugas. Kalau di rumahnya lagi mau pakai, ya kan, ya memang tidak bisa disamakan antara cadar dengan sarung ya. Cuma maksud saya tiap kelembagaan, tiap pemerintahan itu kan punya kebijakan, kalau ini jadi kebijakan. Kenyataannya kan hari ini juga belum jadi kebijakan," ujar Diah.
Sebelumnya, Menag Fachrul Razi mengatakan pernyataannya terkait cadar dan celana cingkrang yang akhirnya menjadi polemik di publik disampaikan agar menjadi gaung sebelum peraturan dikeluarkan ataupun agar masyarakat ingat peraturan-peraturan yang ada. Dia kemudian mengaitkan hak tersebut dengan peraturan berpakaian Pegawai Negeri Sipil (PNS) di instansi pemerintah.
"Semua PNS kembali kepada aturan menggunakan sesuai dengan aturan PNS misalnya. Teman-teman langsung bisa membaca, oh gaungnya sebelumnya sudah digaungkan. Mungkin juga berkaitan dengan celana gantung atau kaitan dengan nikab apa cadar dan sebagainya sehingga gaungnya sudah duluan kita buat sehingga pada saat muncul aturan mudah-mudahan orang tak berkejut lagi," kata Fachrul di The Sultan Hotel & Residence, Jalan Gatot Subroto, Gelora, Tanah Abang, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (5/11).
Fachrul menekankan pernyataan-pernyataan kontroversial itu dibuatnya untuk sebagai pengingat awal. Dia meminta maaf bila pernyataannya memicu kontroversi. Demikian juga pernyataan soal radikalisme yang mengusung paham khilafah.

(azr/zap)

PDIP Praises Minister of Religion who Throw Issues of Veils-Cingkrang Pants
Nov 6 2019, 08:18 by Nur Azizah Rizki Astuti
Jakarta - PDIP 'defends' Minister of Religion (Menag) Fachrul Razi who admitted throwing the issue of the ban on the veil and the trousers to become a reverberation for the people. PDI-P assesses that Fachrul never stated that those two things were prohibited, but he still studied them.
"I think he is also very moderate, yes, in this case he also said that this proposal will still be studied, the proposal which is about the prohibition (veil and cingkrang pants), he will review it. He has a statement, he has a thought, but in a sign he also put the word that this proposal will still be reviewed, "Commission VIII F-PDIP member Diah Pitaloka told reporters on Wednesday (6/11/2019).
"He is in my opinion very fair, very moderate. He didn't say in the Ministry of Religion it would be banned, didn't make a statement. He might have thought, asked, followed, 'let's review it first,'" he added.
According to Diah, it is not a problem if the Ministry of Religion conducts a study of the prohibition of veils and trousers in a government agency. When it comes to uniform problems while on duty Diah analogizes it to the police who are 'forbidden' from wearing gloves.
"To put it simply, for example the National Police Chief said that police cannot use gloves when on duty. That does not mean that people should not wear gloves or forbid people from wearing gloves, only when on duty. veil with a sarong. I mean just every institution, every government has a policy, if it becomes a policy. The fact is that today it hasn't become a policy, "Diah said.
Previously, Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi said his statement related to the veil and trousers which finally became polemic in the public was conveyed so that they would be reverberated before the regulations were issued or so that the public would remember the existing regulations. He then linked these rights to the dress code of Civil Servants (PNS) in government agencies.
"All civil servants return to the rules of using according to the rules of civil servants, for example. Friends can immediately read, oh the echo has previously been echoed. It may also be related to hanging pants or links with niqab what veils and so on so that the echo was made by us so that when it appeared rules, hopefully people will not be surprised anymore, "said Fachrul at The Sultan Hotel & Residence, Jalan Gatot Subroto, Gelora, Tanah Abang, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5).
Fachrul stressed the controversial statements were made as an initial reminder. He apologized if his statement sparked controversy. Likewise, statements about radicalism that carry the understanding of the Khilafah.

(azr / zap)
